24.80.text: First in the spotlight tonight is the boxer Ricky Hatton.

28.08.text: He's answering questions on Only Fools And Horses.

33.44.text: Next, the chef Tony Singh. His specialist subject, tartan.

40.12.text: The actor and comedian Ardal O'Hanlon

42.88.text: answering questions on the band Velvet Underground.

48.36.text: And the antiques expert Kate Bliss on Carl Faberge.

61.36.text: Hello, and welcome to Celebrity Mastermind with me, John Humphrys.

65.36.text: The big difference between this and the regular Mastermind

68.16.text: is that this lot don't only have to worry about the effect

71.36.text: of the spotlight and the black chair and the ticking clock,

74.96.text: it's their hard-earned reputations on the line as well.

78.24.text: And they don't even get paid for it, they're doing it for charity.

83.72.text: A minute and a half on their specialist subject

85.72.text: and then two minutes on general knowledge.

88.28.text: So, let us ask our first contender to join us, please.

98.00.text:
- And your name is? 
- Ricky Hatton.

100.32.text:
- Your chosen charity? 
- Barnabus, for the homeless in Manchester.

104.40.text:
- And your chosen subject? 
- Only Fools And Horses.

166.40.text:
- Batman and Robin. 
- In Strangers On The Shore,

190.96.text: an organisation that insists on complete honesty.

200.96.text: BEEPING I've started so I'll finish.

206.20.text: in the 1991 Christmas special, Miami Twice?

210.80.text:
- David Jason. 
- Is correct. David Jason, it is indeed.

213.96.text: You had one pass, it was Ziggy Sawdust.

218.16.text: That was the name of the tribute act. Ricky, you have scored eight points.

240.20.text:
- And your name is? 
- Tony Singh.

- And your chosen subject? 
- The history of tartan.

700.60.text:
- to be able to distinguish...

707.96.text: about taste and history and whatever else is going on in that region.

714.96.text: essentially whatever food is on our doorstep.

721.84.text: There's some good stuff down south, but Scotland's a little bit better.

724.88.text: The idea of curried haggis, maybe...?

727.00.text: Well, the thing is I'm a classically trained French chef,

730.08.text: so all my Indian cooking is just basically what I've learned from my mum.

733.68.text: So yeah, it's, er...whatever makes you happy, really.

1610.64.text: topical Radio 4 comedy quiz programme called what?

1616.88.text: I know it - I can't think of it.

1618.32.text: I know, I know. I'll tell you, put you out of your misery. The News Quiz.

1624.60.text: Sockeye is a kind of salmon. Very expensive one.

1627.08.text: Mombasa is the principal port of Kenya.

1630.20.text:
- And Worthy Farm is where they have the Glastonbury Festival. 
- Of course.

1647.36.text: Well... The challenge was too great, let's have a look at the scores.

1681.44.text: So, er... You'll have a new billing, now, won't you?

1686.92.text: This is an extraordinary honour. It really is, it's a big part of my childhood.

1691.48.text:
- Good! Well, you earned it. Well done. 
- Yeah, thank you.

1693.96.text: Now, you don't have to be a celebrity

1695.60.text: to take part in the regular Mastermind programme -

1697.76.text: if you would like to appear in the next series on BBC Two,

1704.60.text: And you can follow us on Twitter:

1707.92.text: And do join us again next time for more Masterminds.
